comments:
I received the following excpetion when I use the following code. The exception goes away if I modify the code to use setRuntime() which is a deprecated method.

    facetedProject.setPrimaryRuntime(FacetUtil.getRuntime(serverRuntime),new NullProgressMonitor());


*** ERROR ***: Mon Oct 23 13:58:15 EDT 2006    org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.enablement.nonui.WFTWrappedException
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Primary runtime has to be one of the targeted runtimes.
    	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.setPrimaryRuntimeInternal(FacetedProject.java:880)
    	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.access$9(FacetedProject.java:852)

    	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.setPrimaryRuntime(FacetedProject.java:847)

    	at com.ibm.etools.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.WTPOperation.run(WTPOperation.java:268)

    	at com.ibm.etools.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.WTPOperation$1.run(WTPOperation.java:250)

The code was working a couple of weeks ago. Is there a recent change in the facet API? Moreover, could you explain or give an example of using the setPrimaryRuntime()?

There was no recent changes to this api. The deprecated setRuntime() method is equivalent to calling setTargetedRuntimes() method with a set containing one runtime.

A project can target multiple runtimes at ones. That set is controlled via the setTargetedRuntimes() method. One of those runtimes is a designated primary. This is mainly used for contributing to the classpath. Setting the primary runtime is accomplished via the setPrimaryRuntime() method, but the project first has to target that runtime.
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

traces.message: Primary runtime has to be one of the targeted runtimes.
